data.title: Bill Bromiley – Saban Films
data.text:
BILL BROMILEY

PRESIDENT

Bill Bromiley is President of Saban Films, the recently launched film acquisition and distribution venture from parent company Saban Capital Group.

Prior to joining Saban, Bromiley served as Chief Acquisitions Officer of RLJ Entertainment (formerly known as Image Entertainment), where he was responsible for the acquisition of all content, including feature films, television programming, live events, and special interest titles, and oversaw the development and distribution of the Image, One Village, Madacy, Amity, and Slingshot film brands. He joined the company to launch the feature film division in 2007, and shepherded such films such as Management (Jennifer Aniston, Woody Harrelson); Academy Award® nominee The Way Back (Ed Harris, Colin Farrell); Academy Award® nominee Before the Devil Knows You’re Dead (Philip Seymour Hoffman, Ethan Hawke, Marisa Tomei); The Resident (Hilary Swank); The Numbers Station (John Cusack, Malin Akerman); Devil’s Knot (Reese Witherspoon, Colin Firth), The Double (Richard Gere) and Academy Award® nominated Encounters at the End of the World, directed by Werner Herzog. Bromiley also oversaw the distribution of film libraries such as The Criterion Collection, Lakeshore Entertainment, Handmade Films, and the Imax film library.

Bromiley also previously served as President, First Look Home Entertainment, where he launched and oversaw the home entertainment division for First Look Studios, including sales, marketing, and acquisitions.
